event.descr:
This notification signifies that the specified server has been marked dead. The ServerName identifies the server and the SPIdentfier identifies the session-pic which originated this notification.

jnxMbgGwName %parm[#1]%;

jnxMbgSgwCgServerName %parm[#2]%;

jnxMbgSgwCgServicePicName %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: jnxMbgSgwCgGtpGWDownNotify trap received jnxMbgGwName=%parm[#1]% jnxMbgSgwCgServerName=%parm[#2]% jnxMbgSgwCgServicePicName=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
This notification signifies that the specified server has been marked alive. The ServerName identifies the server and the SPIdentfier identifies the session-pic which originated this notification.

jnxMbgGwName %parm[#1]%;

jnxMbgSgwCgServerName %parm[#2]%;

jnxMbgSgwCgServicePicName %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: jnxMbgSgwCgGtpGWUpNotify trap received jnxMbgGwName=%parm[#1]% jnxMbgSgwCgServerName=%parm[#2]% jnxMbgSgwCgServicePicName=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
This signifies change in the destination of the CDRs (Charging Data Record)

jnxMbgGwName %parm[#1]%;

jnxMbgSgwCgCDRDest %parm[#2]%;

cdrcgf(1) cdrbackup(2) cdrnobackup(3)

jnxMbgSgwCgTSPName %parm[#3]%;

jnxMbgSgwCgCgfIpAddress %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: jnxMbgSgwCgCDRDestNotify trap received jnxMbgGwName=%parm[#1]% jnxMbgSgwCgCDRDest=%parm[#2]% jnxMbgSgwCgTSPName=%parm[#3]% jnxMbgSgwCgCgfIpAddress=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This signifies the Charging daemon is UP on the SP.

jnxMbgGwName %parm[#1]%;

jnxMbgSgwCgServicePicName %parm[#2]%;
event.logmsg: jnxMbgSgwCgServiceUpNotify trap received jnxMbgGwName=%parm[#1]% jnxMbgSgwCgServicePicName=%parm[#2]%

event.descr:
This indicates that the given charging profile underwent a change in the maintenance-mode.

jnxMbgGwName %parm[#1]%;

jnxMbgSgwCgProfileName %parm[#2]%;

jnxMbgSgwCgPrevMMState %parm[#3]%;

jnxMbgSgwCgNewMMState %parm[#4]%;

event.descr:
This trap indicates the alarm status on the node associated with the utilization of inernal memory space for charging records. This alarm is sent outwhen the utilization exceeds or falls below configured high threshold value. Thealarm status (Active/Clear)is indicated by the jnxMbgSgwCgAlarmStatus variable.

jnxMbgGwName %parm[#1]%;

jnxMbgSgwCgTSPName %parm[#2]%;

jnxMbgSgwCgServicePicName %parm[#3]%;

jnxMbgSgwCgMemLimit %parm[#4]%;

memfulldisconnectnew(1) memfulldisconnectnewrslvd(2) memfulldisconnectexistnew(3) memfulldisconnectexistnewrslvd(4)

jnxMbgSgwCgAlarmStatus %parm[#5]%;

raised(1) cleared(2)
event.logmsg: jnxMbgSgwCgMemHighThresNotify trap received jnxMbgGwName=%parm[#1]% jnxMbgSgwCgTSPName=%parm[#2]% jnxMbgSgwCgServicePicName=%parm[#3]% jnxMbgSgwCgMemLimit=%parm[#4]% jnxMbgSgwCgAlarmStatus=%parm[#5]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates the alarm status on the node associated with the utilization of local storage space for charging records. This alarm is sent out when the utilization exceeds or falls below configured high threshold of available disk space. The alarm status (Active/Clear)is indicated by the jnxMbgSgwCgAlarmStatus variable.

jnxMbgGwName %parm[#1]%;

jnxMbgSgwCgAlarmStatus %parm[#2]%;

raised(1) cleared(2)

jnxMbgSgwCgLcsUtil %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: jnxMbgSgwCgLcsThresHighNotify trap received jnxMbgGwName=%parm[#1]% jnxMbgSgwCgAlarmStatus=%parm[#2]% jnxMbgSgwCgLcsUtil=%parm[#3]%
